about_the_game:
SIRE is a narrative card game about the death of a parent, and dealing with the complicated emotions that unleashes. Players combine cards to explore a darkly comedic, surreal world of loss and learning, in a mixture of classic point-n-click adventures and modern digital card games.

FEATURES

  • An experimental yet highly playable art game that mixes a point 'n click adventures card game with FMV video and audio recordings.

  • A story about overcoming personal loss and generational trauma, interwoven with my own exploration of losing my father, as the player travels to a distant land to visit their late father's funeral.

  • A tribute to an imperfect, forgotten artist and an ode to complex parental relationships.

  • Playtime of around 1.5 hours.

  • Museum of Memories that showcases all surviving works of the artist Arthur van Laarhoven.
